node.title: Who needs booster shots and when can I get one?
node.alt: A hand seen with a blue plastic glove on it against blue holds a vial of clear liquid with a label saying COVID-19 vaccine
node.description: From today, booster shots of Pfizer and Moderna are available for anyone who has been fully vaccinated for at least five months. Here's what you need to know about the latest changes.Â
node.content:
["With a new SARS CoV-2 variant, Omicron,\u00a0in our midst, the focus has turned to getting booster shots into Australians' arms earlier.", "The federal government has now cut the waiting time for a booster from six months to five.", "Moderna has\u00a0also been\u00a0provisionally approved\u00a0for use,\u00a0joining Pfizer as a booster option for adults.\u00a0", "Omicron does not\u00a0appear to be more severe than other virus variants, but it is hoped fast-tracking boosters\u00a0will cover waning immunity levels as it\u00a0spreads.\u00a0", "Here's what we know about the latest changes, and how they might impact you.", "Booster shots are encouraged for people who are at a greater risk of developing\u00a0serious illness from COVID-19. They include:\u00a0", "Find out more, here.", "
What vaccine booster can I get?
", "Pfizer and Moderna have both been approved as booster options, including for pregnant women.", "Chief Medical Officer Brendan Murphy says there is no evidence of any difference between the two.", "Also, you do not need to get the same vaccine you received for your first or\u00a0second dose.", "\"If you had Pfizer or AstraZeneca or Moderna as your primary course, you can have either Pfizer or Moderna as a booster,\" Professor Murphy said.", "But, by the same token,\u00a0AstraZeneca will be offered as a booster for people who:\u00a0", "There are also suggestions having a different brand of vaccine for your booster could give you broader\u00a0immunity.", "
How do I book an appointment?
", "Booster shots will be accessible at community pharmacies and health clinics, subject to availability.", "You can book in to get a booster COVID-19 vaccine, here, if you are:", "
Are booster shots safe?
", "Side effects after a booster dose are mild and expected to be similar to those that follow the first two doses.", "A clinical trial of 344 participants found the Moderna booster dose was safe and well tolerated.", "While data on adverse reactions to booster shots are limited, evidence from\u00a0Israel shows\u00a0myocarditis and pericarditis were\u00a0less common after\u00a0a booster Pfizer dose compared to a second Pfizer\u00a0dose.", "Professor Murphy says side effects are generally mild.\u00a0", "", "
Does the arrival of Omicron make boosters more urgent?
"]
